definition: to lodge an accusation/accusation (law)
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: The victim beefed and went to the police.
sentences.chinese: 受害人去向警方告发了。

sentences.english: He turned them in to the police for being involved in the riot.
sentences.chinese: 他向警方告发他们卷入了暴乱。

sentences.english: The young man snitched on the burglary to the police.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻人向警察部门告发了一起夜盗案。

sentences.english: The sewer is treacherous and tells tales of you.
sentences.chinese: 阴沟是阴险的，可以告发你。

sentences.english: Because Wang Fa report, bass and the giant became a rat crossing the street.
sentences.chinese: 因为王发的告发，刘利和擎天成了过街老鼠。

sentences.english: I don't want it to be said I grassed on my mates.
sentences.chinese: 我不希望别人说我告发了同伙。

sentences.english: She hesitated over whether she should report them to the authorities.
sentences.chinese: 她犹豫不定是否应向当局告发他们。

sentences.english: She split on her husband to the government.
sentences.chinese: 她向当局告发了她的丈夫。

sentences.english: That coward ratted on his fellow-workers.
sentences.chinese: 那个胆小鬼告发了和他一起干活的工人。

sentences.english: Mr. Lamo reported Private Manning’s disclosures to federal authorities, and Private Manning was arrested.
sentences.chinese: 拉莫先生向联邦政府告发了曼宁，曼宁随后遭到逮捕。

sentences.english: She felt like a fifth- grader who had snitched on a classmate.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得自己就像一个告发了同班同学的五年级学生。

sentences.english: Because zhuo or report information and hurt, so the police will venture and release.
sentences.chinese: 因为卓或未有告发资雅伤人，故警方便将资雅释放。

sentences.english: Tom is lucky he wasn't prosecuted for taking money under false pretences .
sentences.chinese: 汤姆很幸运，没有人告发他骗取金钱。

sentences.english: I arrested him on whom someone had squealed.
sentences.chinese: 因有人告发，我抓到了他。

sentences.english: He denounced his neighbour for helping the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 他告发他的邻居帮助罪犯。

sentences.english: In Myr he was a prince of thieves, until a rival thief informed on him.
sentences.chinese: 在密尔他是小偷之王，直到竞争对手告发了他。

definition: to frame sb/to accuse falsely
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to inform against sb
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to report secretly/to tip off
to report (an offense to the authorities)/to inform against sb
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to frame/to bring false charges against
to imprison
to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
to expose (e.g., wrongdoing)/to accuse (in court)/to impeach/to denounce
to damage by calumny
to punish sb (for a crime)
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to shield/to harbor/to cover up
to commit a crime
